text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

Halloween is right around the corner, it’s
only a few days away.
It is this Friday and it is my favorite holiday!

To get in the spirit this year I have been
playing the video game Costume Quest.

Which is probably the most adorable RPG Halloween
game that I have played thus far.

It is a game where you and your friends trick
or treat, collect candy

and you unlock these really cool, super powered
costumes. You fight monsters,

and as you play your way through the game
you earn different Creepy Treats.

There are 3 full pages of Creepy Treats in
your game journal. And I thought it

would be perfect to recreate some of these
recipes for Halloween.

So, today we are gonna be making Booger Pies,
Mice Crispy Treats and Barf Roll-ups.
Let’s get started!

Since we are making so many recipes today
from scratch, I am going to explain how

to make each recipe as we go, because that
will be easiest for you.

There are a lot of things going on here, so
the first thing that we’re gonna
be making are Booger Pies. Meep!

So you’re gonna need 2 big mixing bowls,
and in the first mixing bowl we are

going to mix together, 6 ounces of unsalted
butter, 1 and 1/2 cup light

brown sugar, 1/4 cup of dark brown corn syrup
and 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract.

And then we’re gonna blend together until
everything is combined and smooth.

Once it’s all mixed together, now we’re
gonna mix up a lot of our dry ingredients

in this bowl over here. So, we are going to
add 1 and 1/2 cup all purpose flour,

1 and 1/4 cup of graham cracker crumbs, 3/4
teaspoon salt, 1/2 a teaspoon of baking

powder, 1/2 a teaspoon of baking soda, 1/4
teaspoon of ground cinnamon, then

you’re gonna whisk them together. As soon
as you’ve got your dry ingredients and

your wet ingredients, now you are slowly gonna
add your dry ingredients into

your wet ingredients, mixing at a low speed
until everything is combined.

Once these are mixed together you’re gonna
add 2 tablespoons of whole milk, and

you’re just gonna pour it in slowly as you
mix.

Once you’re dough is ready, pick it, put
it on top of your plastic wrap,

you’re gonna flatten it out and cover it
up and put it in the fridge

for 1 hour to chill and then we’re gonna
cut some cookies.

Once your cookie dough has chilled you’re gonna
take a little bit of flower, sprinkle

it on the surface so that your cookie dough
doesn’t stick.

Ohh it smells so good! It smells like graham
cracker!

You’re just gonna sprinkle a little bit of flour on
top, you’re gonna roll it out so it’s about

a 1/4 inch thick, we’re almost there anyways
but we’re just gonna do it a little
bit more.

Once you’ve got your dough rolled out you’re
just gonna take a little bit of

baking spray. Oh, jeez not again! Oh, there
we go! OK! And, you’re gonna spray

your cooking sheet so that they won’t stick,
just a light spray.

Then you’re gonna take a circle cookie cutter,
this is a 3 inch, and cut out

a bunch of cookies. And transfer them to the
baking sheet.

Now that you’ve got all your cookies on
the sheet, you’re gonna heat your oven
to 325 and bake for about 10 minutes.

And just a reminder, you’ll want to bake
an even amount of cookies because

it will take 2 cookies to stick together to
make a Booger Pie.

Once your cookies are done baking you’re
gonna put them on a baking sheet, make

sure they’ve had plenty of time to cool,
and then we are going to stick them

together like a little sandwich. In this little
baggie I have marshmallow cream

which I have dyed green with a drop of food
coloring.

Then you’re just gonna take 2 of the cookies
and stick 'em together.

Once you’re done putting all your cookies
together we’re just gonna stick them in

the fridge for about 15 minutes to chill.
And while those are chilling, we’re

gonna heat up the chocolate. To heat up the
chocolate you put 20 ounces

of bittersweet chocolate into a glass bowl
over boiling water, and mix it

until it melts. Once the chocolate is melted,
remove it from the heat, bring

it over to your baking station and we are
going to allow it to cool.

Now you’re gonna take 2 tablespoons of vegetable
oil, add it to your chocolate

and whisk it together. Now it’s time to
dip our Booger Pies!

This is my favorite part. So over here, I
just, on top of a cutting board, put

a piece of wax paper so that our Booger Pies
do not stick to the surface.

And I’ve got 2 forks over here. So what
you’re gonna do is, pick up one of

your little cookie pies, and you’re gonna
submerge him into the chocolate.

There we go, jiggle it around, and now you’re
gonna pick him up.

Just let the excess chocolate drip off for
a second, just give it a little jiggle.

The you’re just going to transfer it over
to the piece of wax paper and

let the chocolate set. After you’re done
dipping the Booger Pies you’re just

gonna set them in the freezer for about 10
minutes to chill, and while those

are chilling, we’re gonna move onto our
second recipe. We’re gonna make
some Barf Roll-up!

To make Barf Roll-ups, these are apple fruit
roll-ups, they are delicious.

The things you will need, will be: A blender,
you’ll also need some baking spray,

3 granny smith apples, 3/4 cup of regular
sugar, chopped up peanuts, I just bought

regular peanuts and then chopped them up on
a cutting board. 2 tablespoons of fresh

lemon juice, and then you’re gonna need
an apple peeler, to peel your apples,

and a core-er. I use this because it’s just
the easiest thing ever. And I’m gonna

do that on a cutting board. The last thing
that you’ll need is a baking sheet with

a piece of tinfoil on it. I’m using a 17
by 11 inch pan, but you can use whatever
size you have, it’s give or take.

The first thing that you’re gonna do is
peel your apples, peel and core them.

I like to peel them first so I got this little
peeler, and just take your time,

get all that skin off. Now you can use a knife,
but I like to use this

device because it is the easiest way to core
an apple. You just line up the

center hole, right in the middle of your apple
and just press down. And look

at that! The core comes right out, perfect!
Then you’re gonna put your little

apple slices in the blender. Now that we’ve
got all of our apples in the blender

we’re gonna add our sugar. Now we’re gonna
blend them up until we’ve got a nice

smooth consistency. Now we are gonna add our
lemon juice and we are gonna

mix one more time. Once we’ve blended all
of the apples together, you are going

to transfer our fruit puree into a medium-sized
saucepan, we're gonna bring this over to

the stove. Turn it onto medium heat, and we’re
gonna let our apples simmer

for about 35 minutes. And, this part is totally
optional, you can add a little bit

of green food coloring to make it look more
like barf.

After about 35 minutes your mixture will thicken,
it will get gooey, and you will

know it’s time to take it off the heat and
you’re gonna bring it back to
your baking station.

We’re back here at our baking station and
our fruit roll-up mixture is all ready.

And the first thing that you’re gonna do is
make sure that you have a piece of tinfoil

on your baking sheet. And you’re gonna take
a little bit of baking spray, whatever

you’d like, spray it down. Now you’re
just gonna pour the mixture on top, then

you’re gonna do your best to flatten it
out, evenly across the pan with your

spatula. And then we’re gonna sprinkle on
some peanuts on the top.

Now you’re gonna heat your oven to 200 degrees,
and we’re gonna bake this for 3

hours. That is a long time, but we slow bake
fruit leather, that’s just how

you do it. Once your Barf Roll-up is done
baking, give it plenty of time to cool.

It looks so gross! It looks just like from
the game and it looks just like barf!

We are gonna flip it onto a piece of wax paper.
Put the wax paper over the top, and

then 1, 2, 3 flip. Gently peel off the tinfoil,
now we’re gonna cut our apple

Barf Roll-up into strips. I’m just gonna
take a big cutting knife and

cut all the way down. And then, this is the
fun part! This is pretty exciting, OK.

We’re gonna roll it, eeeeewwwww! There you
have it! Barf Roll-up!

Now do this to the rest of your rolls and
we’re on to the next recipe,
Mice Crispy Treats!

The things you will need, will be: 5 cups
of Rice Krispies cereal, 4 cups of

marshmallows, a baking pan, some baking spray,
whatever you’d like to use,

1/4 cup of butter or a 1/2 a stick. And then
to decorate you’ll need:

Black chocolate melts, and sliced almonds
for the little ears. And you’re also

going to need a medium sized saucepan. And
if you’re in a hurry and you don’t

have time to make Rice Krispie treats, they
do sell these little individual

Rice Krispie bars which are about the exact
same size. Let’s get started!

You’re gonna grab your butter, marshmallow,
Rice Krispies and your medium sized

sauce pan and we’re gonna head over to the
stove.

The first thing you’re gonna do is turn
your stove onto low heat and

you’re gonna add your butter and stir frequently
until the butter has

completely melted. And once it’s melted, then 
you’re gonna add all of your marshmallows.

And you’re gonna stir them together until
they have completely melted. And once

they’ve melted you’re gonna to remove
from the heat, and you’re gonna slowly stir

in all of your Rice Krispies. Once you’ve
mixed in all of your Rice Krispies I

came back over to the baking station, and
you’re gonna take a little bit of

baking spray, grease your pan. And then you’re
gonna pour all of your

Rice Krispies into the pan. Then take a piece
of wax paper and you’re gonna put it on top,

and just flatten them down.
Now you’re gonna take your Rice Krispies

and put them in the fridge for about 1 hour
to chill. And while they’re

chilling, we’re gonna heat up our black
chocolate and make some little mouse

whiskers. To make the mouse decorations, the
first thing you’re gonna do

is take a piece of paper, and I’ve just
sketched, I just free-handed these, they

don’t need to be perfect, little mouse ears,
whiskers and tails. And you’re just

gonna slip it underneath a piece of wax paper,
I’ve just taped it down so I’m

just gonna wiggle it under there. And I’ve
melted the black chocolate and you’re

just gonna pour it into a plastic baggie so
I’ll have more control when I’m making

my little shapes and designs. And I put a
number 1 tip at the end so that I would

have a little bit more control. And then you’re
just going to trace all of your

designs. Chocolate dries really quickly, so
as soon as you make your designs

they should be ready in a few minutes. We
just finished our chocolate decorations

and our Rice Krispies have chilled. And now
we are gonna take a big cutting knife

and we’re gonna cut our Rice Krispies out
into little rectangles for our

Mice Crispy treats! Now that we have got our
Rice Krispies rectangles we are

gonna add all of our little mouse decorations.
I’m going to start with the tail,

they’re so cute! And I’m just gonna stick
it in the back. Now that we’ve got all

the little mouse tails on, we are gonna put
on their whiskers and ears. And I’ve

kept the chocolate, so if you want to draw
on little eyeballs, or use the

chocolate to help connect the ears, feel free
to do that, it’s very helpful.
Ta-da!

Here are all of the creepy treats that we
made from the video game Costume Quest!

We made Booger Pies, Barf Roll-ups and Mice
Crispy Treats!

I had so much fun, if you guys have any other
ideas for any other Nerdy Nummies

please let me know, leave me a comment down
below, and I will do my best to
make it happen!

Also, I will post pictures on Facebook, Twitter,
Instagram and Tumblr, and

if you guys make any of these treats, please
send me pictures because I get a big

kick out of seeing your baking creations,
I love them!
OK, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
And, oh! Happy Halloween!
